text: [Music]
babbino once upon a time there lived a
lad who was sharp and intelligent and
had an insatiable appetite for knowledge
the child was called babbino and he was
so full of questions that soon his
father had no answers left to give him
so the father found a wise master and
sent babbino with him so that the master
my tutor Vivino
in a thousand different arts the lad
spent twelve years studying with his
teacher and when he became a young men
and when he had learned all that the
master could teach him Vivino returned
to his father my son how long have I
waited for you tell me about all that
you have learned father these nasty
birds a storm is coming quick father we
must find shelter there is a cave this
way there is no storm coming the sky is
clear father
birds and creatures of the forest know
the world better than we do and see
father oh did you know from the sparrows
one of them told me it also showed me
the weight of this cave oh is that even
possible I know the language of all
birds and beasts father my master taught
me would your master taught you to
become a wizard it is not like the all
these years all that money and the only
trade my son has learnt is the language
of ghastly creatures is that what I
shall tell our relatives and friends
what do you expect people will come to
you to ask them what their dog is saying
but father my business is run by humans
not animals what is to become of it now
go away Bobby no leave it once and come
back to me only after you have learnt
something worthwhile and so Peppino left
how he wished she could tell his father
that all the knowledge of the world was
contained in the wisdom of nature and
her creatures but that was not to be so
he wandered on whenever babbino was
tired he would ask a snake or a bird as
to where there was a cave nearby and
they would lead him there when he was
hungry he asked them where to find food
and water and they would show him the
way he spoke to them laughed with them
and enjoyed his time in the wilderness
then one day he came upon a tribe why
are you barking so stay quiet let me go
and tie him up no wait what is it little
one the dog is saying that a group of
robbers is going to attack the tribe
after midnight tonight there will be a
group of four men who will come from the
southwest how would you know because I
understand the language of birds and
beasts these creatures perceive the
world in a way we humans never can they
talked to the winds and they speak with
the sky and they are never wrong then we
should listen and make arrangements
accordingly so that night the tribals
hid behind trees and stacks of grain and
waited for the thieves sure enough as
the dog had said four thieves came from
the southwest that the tribals were
above them
startled leaves ran away and right and
thus their village and their belongings
were saved thank you so much sir babbino
you saved our tribe not I but rather
your animals saved your tribe it is only
because of you that we now know what
great wisdom our animals possess
please stay do not leave I must yet
wander in the forests but I will visit
you again
[Applause]
so Peppino went into the forest again
and wandered for a few weeks more one
day he heard frogs croaking louder than
he had ever heard frogs croak and before
he went closer and sitting on their
lotuses the Frog seemed to be playing
catch with a small bottle the Frog saw
him brought him fruit and not to eat and
showed him a place where he could rest
the next morning babbino set out again
and came upon a small village
he could hear great crying and moaning
from one of the houses so he went there
what is to become of my daughter please
do not despair a miracle might yet
happen excuse me madam might I ask you
what ails you so their daughter has
taken seriously ill they had got
medicines from the next town but the
servant dropped the bottle on his way
back now there is not enough time to
bring more medicine to save the poor
girl I know where the bottle of medicine
has fallen in the forest send for the
servant at once or better get me a horse
how would you know where it is sir I
shall explain all that later do get me a
horse yes right away so babbino mounted
the horse and rode to where the frogs
were
hey I found the owner of the bottle
would you please bring it to me thank
you
levena took the medicine and gave it to
the parents of the sick child as soon as
she had the dose the child felt better
and it was clear that she would now be
saved the family and the village
rejoiced thank you you saved my
daughter's life it is not i but the
creatures of the forest who saved her it
is only because of you that we now know
what great wisdom our animals possess
please stay do not leave I must get
wander in the forests but I will visit
you again so babbino wandered in the
woods for a few weeks more and one day
he came upon two men he sat down with
them to eat when a hawk came there and
spoke with libido he says that in the
town just outside the forest there is to
be an election for their next governor
tomorrow at the stroke of 1:00 in the
afternoon his friend the eagle will
select the next governor and he says
that one of us might be the one an eagle
how weird and how would you know it is
not weird my friend
it is wise I know because I understand
the language of the birds and the beasts
these creatures perceive the world in a
way we humans never can they talked to
the winds and they speak with the sky
and they are never wrong in that case we
must head to the town immediately you
both carry on I shall join later or I am
still a bit tired and sleepy and I want
to rest a while there we will meet see
you there
so the two men went into the town where
a great crowd had gathered to see
who their new governor would be when the
clock struck one the eagle flew up from
its perch in the oak tree it flew high
watching encircling the crowd looking
for the next governor and then suddenly
it swooped to the gate at the tail and
perched on the shoulder of the man
standing there
that man was Bob inna babbino was
shocked until who should he see standing
before him but his master and the great
Eagle who has chosen Rubino shall be the
new governor for this town for he who
understands and shows respect to
creatures of the forest will rule humans
too with wisdom and compassion so with
great pomp in a chariot made of gold
lovino was taken to the mansion of the
governor Vivino called for his father
and finally his father understood that
indeed birds and beasts perceived the
world in a way we humans never can they
talked to the winds and they speak with
the sky and they are never wrong and
just as the master had said babbino the
man who showed respect to animals rules
his human subjects with compassion and
wisdom for the rest of his days
[Music]
